raw_text:
Robinson wants dual code success
 
 England rugby union captain Jason Robinson has targeted dual code success over Australia on Saturday.
 
 Robinson, a former rugby league international before switching codes in 2000, leads England against Australia at Twickenham at 1430 GMT. And at 1815 GMT, Great Britain's rugby league team take on Australia in the final of the Tri-Nations tournament. "Beating the Aussies in both games would be a massive achievement, especially for league," said Robinson. England have the chance to seal their third autumn international victory after successive wins over Canada and South Africa, as well as gaining revenge for June's 51-15 hammering by the Wallabies. Meanwhile, Great Britain could end 34 years of failure against Australia with victory at Elland Road. Britain have won individual Test matches, but have failed to secure any silverware or win the Ashes (with a series victory) since 1970.
 
 "They have a great opportunity to land a trophy and it would be a massive boost for rugby league in this country if we won," said Robinson. "I know the boys can do it - they've defeated the Aussies once already in the Tri-Nations." But Robinson was not losing sight of the task facing his England side in their final autumn international. "For us, we've played two and won two this November," he said. "If we beat Australia it would be the end to a great autumn series for England. If we stumble then we'll be looking back with a few regrets. Robinson also revealed that the union side had sent the Great Britain team a good luck message ahead of the showdown in Leeds. "We signed a card for them today and will write them an email on Saturday wishing them all the best," said Robinson. "Everyone has signed the card - a lot of the guys watch league and we support them fully. "Both games will be very tough and hopefully we'll both do well."
llama3.2:1b: Jason Robinson, England rugby union captain, aims for dual code success over Australia in two upcoming matches: a rugby union match at Twickenham on Saturday against England, and a rugby league match at Elland Road on Sunday against Great Britain. Both teams face high stakes, with the possibility of securing their third autumn international victory, defeating Canada and South Africa previously, and ending 34 years of failure against Australia.
llama3.2:3b: Jason Robinson, England rugby union captain and former rugby league player, wants dual code success against Australia in two matches on Saturday. He believes beating Australia would be a massive achievement for rugby league in England, particularly if Great Britain wins the Tri-Nations tournament final. Robinson's England side has already secured autumn international victories over Canada and South Africa, while Great Britain aims to end 34 years of failure against Australia.
gemma2:2b: England rugby union captain Jason Robinson hopes to achieve dual code success by beating Australia on Saturday.  Great Britain also aims to overcome their 34-year history of defeat against Australia in the final of the Tri-Nations tournament. Both sides have an opportunity to win a major victory and boost their respective codes.  Robinson says his England side is focused on achieving their own goals, while offering support to Great Britain.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Robinson aims to secure dual code success in England, aiming for victory against Australia while hoping for a silverware at Elland Road. He is confident that England can land the trophy they've been dreaming of if they win against Australia, but he's not losing sight of the task ahead as well. The union side sent a team card to Great Britain, wishing them all the best success on their journey into rugby league.
qwen2.5:1.5b: England rugby union captain Jason Robinson targets dual code success in two upcoming matches against Australia, aiming for autumn international victories and revenge over the Wallabies after a 51-15 loss earlier this year while Great Britain's rugby league team faces the country they have lost to 34 times.
qwen2.5:3b: England rugby union captain Jason Robinson aims for dual code success against Australia, first in rugby union at Twickenham (1430 GMT) then in rugby league in Leeds (1815 GMT). England has won recent autumn internationals over Canada and South Africa. A win would be a significant achievement for Great Britain's rugby league team after 34 years of failure against Australia, who last defeated them in the Ashes series in 1970. Robinson expects his union side to beat Australia, but acknowledges their tough task ahead. Both teams have sent messages of good luck and support to each other.

The first sentence says Robinson wants dual code success in England rugby union. That seems important—maybe dual codes refer to multiple scoring systems? He mentions he was a former international before switching codes in 2000, so that's his background.

Then there are the games scheduled at Twickenham and Elland Road. The times given are GMT and 1815 GMT. I should make sure to include those timings correctly.

Robinson is ahead of three autumn wins over Canada, South Africa, and Wallabies. That gives him a good start in league standings. He's aiming for another fall for the Ashes, which might help them regain international status.

England are trying to end 34 years without a win against Australia. They have individual Test wins but haven't gotten silverware or won the Ashes since 1970. That's a big point he mentions.

He talks about the opportunity to win a trophy and boost rugby in England, emphasizing that they've already beaten Australia twice this November. He also says both games will be tough but hopeful for them both doing well.

There's some luck mentioned by sending a message ahead of the showdown in Leeds. A lot of players are watching the league. Both teams have strong performances, so Robinson is confident both will do their best.

</think>

Robinson wants dual code success in England rugby union and aims for a third autumn international win over Australia. The English team plays at Twickenham against Great Britain on GMT and at Elland Road against Australia on 1815 GMT. Robinson has three previous wins but aims to end 34 years without beating Australia, having secured Test victories. He mentions the opportunity to claim a trophy and boosts rugby in England, confident both teams will perform well despite tough games.
tinyllama:1.1b: England rugby union captain Jason Robinson is aiming for dual code success in the upcoming autumn international against Australia. Robinson, who switched codes from rugby league to rugby union after graduating from the Australian University of New South Wales in 2000, leads England's side at Twickenham against Australia on Saturday (14:30 GMT), while Great Britain's rugby league team will take on Australia at Elland Road. Both sides have the opportunity to secure their first win over Australia since 1970, with victory in their final autumn international game likely to boost rugby league in this country. Robinson is confident that his England side can achieve this goal, but also reminds that they are still facing a difficult task given that the Australian team has won individual Test matches and lost both of their series victories. However, Robinson remains optimistic and believes that a good performance against Australia will be an "eighties-style send-off" for England.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Rugby fans: what a spectacular match it would be to see England and Australia duel in Twickenham on Saturday, while Great Britain also aims to snatch revenge from the Wallabies with another win at Elland Road. However, if Rugby league takes a victory in both matches, it will be an incredible accomplishment for the sport in this country. If they manage to clinch both, it would certainly be a source of pride and motivation for the English rugby union team.
phi:2.7b: England rugby union captain Jason Robinson targets success in a dual competition against Australia, where he is leading England at their home ground. If he achieves this, it would be a significant achievement, especially for the rugby league game. Great Britain also faces Australia for the first time since 1973 and hopes to finally win a trophy after 34 years of losses. The team has already won two games in November against Canada and South Africa, giving them confidence but also pressure. Robinson wishes the England team all the best before their final autumn international, while also expressing support for the Great Britain team.
orca-mini:3b: England rugby union captain Jason Robinson wants to achieve dual code success by leading his team to victory over Australia in both their autumn international matches, while also helping Great Britain's rugby league team win the Tri-Nations tournament. He stressed that beating the Wallabies in both games would be a significant achievement for league and praised the boys' ability to defeat them once in the Tri-Nations. However, he was not losing sight of the task facing his England side in their final autumn international.
